p: High activities against ABTS were reported for macrocyclic binuclear metal complexes: IC 50 = 10 ± 0.6 µM and 18 ± 0.5 µM for Cu 2+ complexes Cu 2PO and Cu 2PC ( Figure 5), respectively [ 6], and 38 ± 0.9 µM and 28 ± 0.2 µM for Fe 3+ complexes Fe 2PO and Fe 2PC ( Figure 5) [ 15]. These complexes are inhibitors as powerful as ascorbic acid (IC 50 = 14.9 ± 0.5 µM), although the inhibitory capacities are moderate when compared with glutathione (<12.5 µM) and caffeic acid phenethyl ester (<12.5 µM). The binuclear core may be one of the factors for the efficiency, as suggested by the lower activities of the L14 complexes.
